com.cleo.lexicom.certmgr.external

Class CertificateInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cleo.lexicom.certmgr.external.CertificateInfo

  • public class CertificateInfo
extends java.lang.Object
    Certificate information for generating a self-signed user certificate and private key. Refer to ICertManagerRunTime.generateUserCertKey(String,CertificateInfo,String,boolean).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  CertificateInfo.PubKeyAlg
      Enum to identify public key algorithms.

    • Method Detail

      • setCommonName

        public void setCommonName(java.lang.String commonName)
        Set the certificate subject's common name. This is the only subject field required; emailAddress, organizationalUnit, organization, locality, stateOrProvince, and country are all optional.
        Parameters:
        commonName - the certificate subject's common name

      • setEmailAddress

        public void setEmailAddress(java.lang.String emailAddress)
        Set the certificate subject's email address. This is optional.
        Parameters:
        emailAddress - the certificate subject's email address

      • setOrganizationalUnit

        public void setOrganizationalUnit(java.lang.String organizationalUnit)
        Set the certificate subject's organizational unit. This is optional.
        Parameters:
        organizationalUnit - the certificate subject's organizational unit

      • setOrganization

        public void setOrganization(java.lang.String organization)
        Set the certificate subject's organization. This is optional.
        Parameters:
        organization - the certificate subject's organization

      • setLocality

        public void setLocality(java.lang.String locality)
        Set the certificate subject's locality (e.g. city). This is optional.
        Parameters:
        locality - the certificate subject's locality

      • setStateOrProvince

        public void setStateOrProvince(java.lang.String stateOrProvince)
        Set the certificate subject's state or province. This is optional.
        Parameters:
        stateOrProvince - the certificate subject's state or province

      • setCountry

        public void setCountry(java.lang.String country)
        Set the certificate subject's country. This is optional.
        Parameters:
        country - the certificate subject's country

      • setCrlDistributionPoint

        public void setCrlDistributionPoint(java.lang.String crlDistributionPoint)
        Set the CRL Distribution Point URI to be added to certificate extension. This is optional.
        Parameters:
        crlDistributionPoint - the CRL distribution point URL

      • setValidFor

        public void setValidFor(int validFor)
        Set the certificate's validity period in months. Must be between 1 and 96 months. Defaults to 6 months.
        Parameters:
        validFor - the certificate's validity period in months

      • setSignatureAlgorithm

        public void setSignatureAlgorithm(int signatureAlgorithm)
        Set the signature algorithm.
        Parameters:
        signatureAlgorithm - the signature algorithm, either MD5 (default), SHA1, SHA256, SHA384, or SHA512

      • setDigitalSignature

        public void setDigitalSignature(boolean digitalSignature)
        Set the certificate's key usage to include digital signatures. If the user certificate is going to be used for an SSL client or for S/MIME (AS2) signing, the key usage should include digital signatures.
        Parameters:
        digitalSignature - true if the certificate's key usage should include digital signatures

      • setKeyEncipherment

        public void setKeyEncipherment(boolean keyEncipherment)
        Set the certificate's key usage to include key encipherment. If the user certificate is going to be used for an SSL server or for S/MIME (AS2) encryption, the key usage should include key encipherment.
        Parameters:
        keyEncipherment - true if the certificate's key usage should include key encipherment

      • setServerAuth

        public void setServerAuth(boolean serverAuth)
        Set the certificate's extended key usage to include server authentication. If the user certificate is going to be used for a TLS server, the extended key usage should include server authentication.
        Parameters:
        serverAuth - true if the certificate's extended key usage should include server authentication

      • setClientAuth

        public void setClientAuth(boolean clientAuth)
        Set the certificate's extended key usage to include client authentication. If the user certificate is going to be used for a TLS client, the extended key usage should include client authentication.
        Parameters:
        clientAuth - true if the certificate's extended key usage should include client authentication

      • setSubjectKeyIdentifier

        public void setSubjectKeyIdentifier(boolean subjectKeyIdentifier)
        Set the certificate's Subject Key Identifier extension as a means of identifying the particular public key being used.
        Parameters:
        subjectKeyIdentifier - true if the certificate should include the Subject Key Identifier extension

      • setAuthorityKeyIdentifier

        public void setAuthorityKeyIdentifier(boolean authorityKeyIdentifier)
        Set the certificate's Authority Key Identifier extension as a means of identifying the public key corresponding to the private key used to sign a certificate. (Internal Use Only!)
        Parameters:
        authorityKeyIdentifier - true if the certificate should include the Authority Key Identifier extension

      • setCrlSign

        public void setCrlSign(boolean crlSign)
        Set the certificate's key usage to include CRL signing. (Internal Use Only!)
        Parameters:
        crlSign - true if the certificate's key usage should include CRL signing.

      • setKeyCertSign

        public void setKeyCertSign(boolean keyCertSign)
        Set the certificate's key usage to include key signing - used when creating a CA certificate. (Internal Use Only!)
        Parameters:
        keyCertSign - true if the certificate's key usage should include key signing.

      • setAddCrlDistributionPoint

        public void setAddCrlDistributionPoint(boolean addCrlDistributionPoint)
        Sets the indicator as to whether the certificate should include a CRL Distribution Points extension. (Internal Use Only!)
        Parameters:
        addCrlDistributionPoint - true if the certificate should include the CRL Distribution Points extension

      • setStrength

        public void setStrength(int strength)
        Set the private key strength in bytes. Can be either 512, 1024, 2048, 3072 or 4096 bytes. Defaults to 1024 bytes.
        Parameters:
        strength - the private key strength
